title: How to Know if You're a Payne Whitney Star
author: Aryeh Coburn-Soloway
text:
Yale’s student body is pretty darn active as a whole. Whether you play a varsity sport, frequent the IM fields, or run up/down Science Hill twice a day in between classes, many of us enjoy the benefits of rigorous physical activity. But, how do you see yourself? Do you consider yourself a gym-rat? Do you feel that climbing the three stairs to your first-floor room constitutes enough muscle exertion on a daily basis?

1. The Payne Whitney Singlet-Guy. +1



If you know who this guy is without further explanation and no longer do a double-take when he walks into Payne Whitney’s 4th floor gym, take a point! If you don’t know Singlet-Guy, in short, he is a short, bald man with glasses who wears a one-piece American flag wrestling singlet every time he works out. Oh, and he’s EXTREMELY RIPPED! Like, HOLY SHIT dude’s at bodybuilder level. There’s been some speculation about roid-usage, but we’re not going to address that here.

2. You Take the Elevator -1



“Dude, the gym’s all the way up on the 4th floor, and I’m about to bust 10 miles out on the treadmill and do 100 bodyweight squats not about to use my legs for an extra 30 seconds.” - Anonymous Bro

But if you DO take the stairs instead leaning casually against the wall of Payne Whitney’s elevators, props!

Personally, I only take the stairs when there are cute chicks waiting for the elevator. I imagine that they’re thinking “Wow, that guy must be super-athletic to go to the gym AND still have the energy to take the stairs.”

3. You have protein in your bottle… +1
